Ghadeer is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can expand her work in mobile phone recharge cards, so she can improve her financal level.

loans.use: to sell mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Fadya

texts.en:
Fadya is 32 years old and a married woman, a mother of 3 children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Fadya is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can expand her project in cosmetics sales so her income will increase.

loans.use: to expand her cosmetics sales

loans.name: Rabee'a

texts.en:
Rabee'a is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Rabee'a is 32 years old and a married woman; she lives in Sahab, Jordan.

Rabee'a is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can improve her household living conditions and make her home more healthy.

loans.use: to improve her household living conditions

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
Doña Dania, tiene 48 años de edad,  esta casada,  tiene 3 hijas y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas en su propia casa de habitación en el departamento de Valle en el sur de Honduras. El negocio de Doña Dania es una pulpería en la que vende azúcar, maíz, café, arroz, frijoles, manteca, margarina, papel higiénico, detergente, jabón de ropa, jabón de Baño, utensilios escolares, embutidos, lácteos, etc., en la zona sur de Honduras. Doña Dania esta solicitando la cantidad de 20,000.00 lempiras para la compra de mercadería para la compra de azúcar, maíz, café, arroz, frijoles, manteca, margarina, papel higiénico, detergente, jabón de ropa y otra mercadería de esta manera generar mayores ventas en su negocio, por lo tanto sus ingresos serán mejores, y que sus clientes encuentren de todo en un solo lugar.
El sueño de Doña Dania esta ubicar un mejor local, con mejores condiciones para su negocio, y de esta manera, ofrecer mejor calidad en sus servicios y productos.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Dania is 48 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives with her husband and three children in their own house in the department of Valle in the south of Honduras. Dania’s business is a small grocery store where she sells sugar, corn, coffee, rice, beans, lard, margarine, toilet paper, detergent, washing powder, soap, school materials, sausages, dairy products, etc. in the southern part of Honduras. 

Dania is asking for 20,000 lempiras to buy goods for her shop, such as sugar, corn, coffee, rice, beans, lard, margarine, toilet paper, detergent, washing powder and other items. In this way she will increase sales in her business resulting in a better income, as well as ensure that her customers can obtain everything they need in one place. 

Dania’s dream is to obtain a better shop for her business with better facilities so that she can improve the quality of the products and services she offers. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to buy sugar, corn, coffee, rice, beans, lard, margarine, toilet paper, detergent, washing powder and other items for her business.

loans.name: Alex Adan

texts.es:
Don Alex, tiene 34 años de edad,  esta casado, no tiene  hijos y vive con su esposa y su madre en su propia casa de habitación en el departamento de Valle en el sur de Honduras. El negocio de Don Alex es una pulpería en la que vende azúcar, maíz, café, arroz, frijoles, manteca, margarina, papel higiénico, detergente, jabón de ropa, jabón de Baño, utensilios escolares, embutidos, lácteos, etc. en la zona sur de Honduras. Don Alex esta solicitando la cantidad de 20,000.00 lempiras para la compra de azúcar, maíz, café, arroz, frijoles, manteca, margarina, papel higiénico, detergente, jabón de ropa, jabón de Baño y otra mercadería, de esta manera generar mayores ventas en su negocio, por lo tanto sus ingresos serán mejores, y que sus clientes encuentren de todo en un solo lugar.
El sueño de Don Alex esta la idea, de expandir su negocio aun más y de ser así colocar un puesto de venta de Abarrotería en el mercado municipal de Nacaome.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Alex, who is 34 years old, is married and does not have children. He lives with his wife and his mother in his own house in the department of Valle in the south of Honduras. Alex's business is a small grocery store in which he sells sugar, corn, coffee, rice, beans, lard, margarine, toilet paper, dish soap, laundry detergent, bath soap, school supplies, deli meats, dairy products, etc. in the southern part of Honduras. 

Alex is requesting the amount of 20,000 lempiras to purchase sugar, corn, coffee, rice, beans, lard, margarine, toilet paper, dish soap, laundry detergent, bath soap, and other merchandise. This purchase will generate greater sales in his business, and therefore his income will be better, and his customers will find everything in one single place. 

Alex's dream is the idea of expanding his business even more, and when that happens, opening a grocer's shop in the municipal market of Nacaome.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to purchase sugar, corn, coffee, rice, beans, lard, margarine, toilet paper, dish soap, laundry detergent, bath soap, and other merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is engaged in hog raising, but she also sells other commodities aside from raising hog. She is also managing a school canteen but only on school days. Since it is vacation now, her focus is her hog raising business. She would like to request a loan of PHP 7,000 as additional business capital such as feed and additional piglet for her business. She also plans to purchase some commodities for her canteen in preparation for the school year.

Lydia's income is just enough to meet the needs of their family and she hopes that she can have the opportunity to make her business grow, and hopefully expand it someday. Lydia believes that “if there’s a will, there’s a way”. She knows that they will be able to survive life’s difficulties because she never gives up looking for resources for her family. Lydia is 49 years old. She is married to Alfredo and they are living in the rural and mountainous village of San Rafael (Cabisera 17-21) Isabela. They were blessed with four children; three of them are still studying. They are: Jeffrey, Janice, Jo-em; the younger two are still in grade school.

loans.use: to buy additional piglet and sack of feeds for her business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en: Aurora is 40 years old. She lives in Andabuen village with her husband and six children. Aurora and her husband run a farm where they cultivate land and raise hogs. Aurora is very happy for her land business which she needs sufficient financial means. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase feed and vitamins to fatten her hog and sell it in the future. This will allow Aurora to complete her business successfully and have a stable income for her family during the year.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hog

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her son.

Amal is a 46-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Jordan and is supporting four members of her family.

Amal has a home-based business. She sells clothes and cosmetics products so she is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics for business purposes

Fatimah is a conservative person who does not wish to upload her picture to the internet so the man shown in the photo is her brother.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 36-year-old married woman from Al Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She supports three members of her family. Sawsan is looking to improve her family's living conditions and is therefore requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to do maintenance work on her house.
Sawsan is a conservative person who does not wish to upload her picture to the internet so the woman shown in the photo is her mother.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on her house.

loans.name: Sa'adeyeh

Sa'adeyeh started her business years ago with a willingness to turn her skill in making straw products into a job to generate income for her family. She is looking to train her daughters and the women in her neighborhood in making straw products through making use of the social service center in her area.
Sa'adeyeh is looking to establish her own shop and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to make straw products.

Rana is looking to establish her own shop to increase her stock of products and improve her income.
Rana is a conservative person who does not wish to upload her picture to the internet so the man shown in the photo is her husband.

loans.use: to purchase women cloaks for trading purposes

Hadeel is looking to improve her family's living conditions and is therefore requesting a loan of 300 JOD to do maintenance work on her house.
As Hadeel is under 30 years old her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on her house.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 43-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan. She supports six members of her family.
Layla produces handmade embroidery. She is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to purchase materials needed for her business. Layla is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making handmade embroidery.

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en:
Fayzeh is a 32-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to paint her house.
Fayzeh is a conservative person who does not wish to upload her picture to the internet so the man shown in the photo is her husband.

loans.use: to paint her house.

loans.name: Los Eloteros Group

texts.es: Yaneth es miembro del Grupo Solidario Los Eloteros, tiene 21 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica a hacer viajes expresos. Yaneth  inicio hace 3 años con la venta de ropa usada, ya que sus vecinas le pedían que vendiera y fue así como comenzó con la venta de ropa. Los desafíos que se le presentan a Yaneth es que las ventas bajan en algunas temporadas del año. Ella está solicitando este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropa con estilos que estén a la moda para así poder llamar la atención de sus clientes y de este modo pueda aumentar sus ventas. Ella comienza a trabajar desde las 7:00 A.M hasta las 4:00 P.M, su desventaja es que cuando da al crédito no siempre le pagan puntualmente. Sus metas es prosperarse y tener su propio local con las diferentes prendas de vestir para poder tener mejores ingresos y así ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. Yaneth es es el primer ciclo que solicita en FAMA  y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a member of the Eloteros Group. She is 21 years old, she is married, and she has two children. Her husband makes a living offering short trips.  

Three years ago Yaneth began selling used clothes based on requests she received from her neighbors.  The challenges she faces are seasonal drops in sales.  She is requesting this loan to invest in more clothes of the current fashions so that she can attract more customers and increase her sales.  

She works from 7:00 AM until 4:00 PM.  Her biggest challenge is that when she provides her customers with a line of credit, they don't always pay her back on time.  Her goals are to be successful and to have her own store where she can sell different styles of clothing so she can make a bigger income.  She wants to help her husband with the household expenses and those of her children.  

This is the first time Yaneth has asked for a loan from FAMA and she plans to repay her debt punctually.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe  DJANTOYERELA  ont  en moyenne 43  ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de YANGASSO   dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de diverses marchandises et elles font le jardinage. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  3 eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents.
Madame AWANI  (1ère femme debout à droite de la photo) excelle dans la vente de diverses marchandises. Elle est très sollicitée dans la ville de YANGASSO. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de marchandises diverses (arachides, calebasses   et du thé du sucre). Elle s’approvisionne tous les lundis à la foire de SAN et à BLA   Elle effectue ses ventes en faisant   au  comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame AWANI  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in extended traditional families, the four women of the DJANTOYERELA group are on average 43 years old with 4 children. They all live in YANGASSO in the Segou region (4th administrative region of Mali) and met through living in the same neighbourhood, through business contacts and family ties. They buy and sell various products and they do gardening.
Aiming to satisfy the needs of their expanding and demanding clientele, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme and having repaid the two previous loans correctly, they are on their 3rd loan.
Awani (1st woman standing on the right in the photo) is extremely good at selling certain products. She is greatly in demand in the town of YANGASSO.
She intends to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of varying merchandise (peanuts, calabashes, tea and sugar). She buys her stock on Mondays at the market in San and in Bla. She sells retail for cash and for credit to a mixed clientele.
With this loan, Awani hopes to make an average monthly profit of 5000 FCFA which will be used for reinvestment in her business and to assist her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase various products.

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME  ont en moyenne  43 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à YANGASSO  (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, des articles de boutique, du poisson séché, des tubercules, des fruits et légumes, des céréales, des habillements et de la restauration.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les   prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME sont  à leurs dixièmes prêts solidaires.
AMI, la restauratrice (c'est la première femme à gauche sur la photo, qui a la marmite sur la tête ) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de 100kg de riz, 3 bidons d’huile de 20 litres, 2 sacs d’oignons frais, un sac d’oignon séché, un carton de cube maggi, un sac de sel de 25 kg et une grande quantité d’épices. AMI  effectue ses ventes dans sa gargote située au marché de YANGASSO, en détail et au comptant  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  Elle s’approvisionne à la grande foire de KOUTIALA..      
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Djiguiseme group have an average age of 43, an average of five children, and all live in large extended traditional families in Yangasso (fourth administrative region of Mali).  They met each other through family ties and sell various items, including condiments, small store merchandise, dried fish, tubers, fruits and vegetables, cereals, clothing, and prepared food.

After paying back their previous loans, the women in the Djiguiseme group are on their tenth cooperative loan.  Ami, the restaurateur (the first woman on the left with a pot on her head), plans to use her loan to buy three 100-kg sacks of rice, three 20-liter cans of oil, two bags of fresh onions, one bag of dried onions, a carton of seasoning cubes, a 25-kg bag of salt, and a large quantity of spices.  Ami sells her food out of her small restaurant in the Yangasso market, on a cash and credit basis to a customer base made up of men and women.  She buys her ingredients in the large market in Koutiala.  She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which she will use for medical expenses, food, and school fees; the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy restaurant ingredients.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont  en moyenne 40  ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de YANGASSO dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de calebasses   et  de diverses marchandises. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 7 e prêt solidaire.
Madame, MINATA (2 eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  4 colis de calebasses en raison de 70 calebasses par colis vente du mois. MINATA  s’approvisionne à la grande foire de BLA.. Elle effectue ses ventes   au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de   femmes a la foire de YNAGASSO et les jours ordinaires a domicile.
Avec ce prêt, Madame MNATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married in extended traditional families, the women who compose the TIESSIRI group average 40 years of age and 5 children each.  They all live in the town of Yangasso, in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of Mali), and they know each other through family and neighborhood ties.  They buy and sell calabash and other goods.

In order to increase their business, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their seventh solidarity loan.

Minata (second from the right in the photo) is planning to use her loan to buy four boxes of calabash, each box containing 70 calabash gourds to be sold in a month.  Minata buys her goods at the large market of Bla.  She sells for retail and cash at the Yangasso market, and, on ordinary days, from her home.  Her customer base mostly consists of women.

With this loan, Minata is expecting average monthly profits to reach 18,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of some household needs.

loans.use: to buy calabash gourds.

loans.name: Burenjargal

texts.en:
Burenjargal is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, the elder two children are school students and the younger one is in kindergarten. 

She started her sewing business in 2008. She sews traditional deel and homeware products. She is a certified professional tailor whose skill is excellent and well known around the neighborhood. 

She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "My business is finally picking up. Since my business is the only income in the family, I have to work even harder". She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy sewing materials to make insulated tent blankets and traditional Mongolian cloths.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials to make insulated tent blankets and traditional Mongolian cloths

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La señora Gumercinda,  cuenta con su negocio de venta de productos por catalogo, como ser cremas, perfumes, lociones, cosméticos, shampoo, ropa interior, toallas entre otros, desde hace Ocho años y la mayoría de sus ventas son por encargo  y los fines de semana sale a vender de manera ambulante por su colonia y algunas colonias cercanas, gracias a los ingresos que recibe por su negocio a logrado mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ya que ahora puede alquilar un apartamento mas grande para poder vivir cómodamente con su esposo e hijos.
Doña Gumercinda esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 10,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería, lociones, perfumes y ropa interior ya que ahorita no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra, su sueño es poder ver crecer su negocio y que sus hijos estudien hasta terminar la universidad.
Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Abril 2012
texts.en:
Gumercinda has a business selling products through catalogs such as creams, perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, shampoo, undergarments, and towels among other things.  She has had this business for eight years.  The majority of her sales are pre-orders and on weekends she sells these products door to door in her town and in nearby towns.  Thanks to the income she receives from her business, she has improved her living conditions as she can now rent a larger apartment to live comfortably with her husband and children. 

Gumercinda is requesting a loan for 10,000 Honduran lempiras (HNL) to buy merchandise, lotions, perfumes, and undergarments because she does not have enough capital right now to purchase these items.  Her dream is to grow her business and for her children to study and finish college. 

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – April 2012

loans.use: to buy merchandise, lotions, perfumes, and undergarments for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.es:
La señora Blanca, se dedica a su pequeño negocio de Pulpería, ofreciéndole a sus clientes variedad de productos como ser, refrescos, arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, leche, huevos, pan entre otros,  hace tres años que la tiene y con estos ingresos mas la ayuda de su esposo han salido adelante con sus hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando,  debido a su buen carisma y su amabilidad Doña Blanca cuenta con muchos clientes, su actividad comienza desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche, ella abre su pulpería todos los días de la semana.
Doña Blanca esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 10,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de jabón, detergente, café, Maseca, arroz, jugos, confites embutidos, frijoles y otros productos.
Doña Blanca espera que PRISMA le apoye con el crédito ya que necesita surtir su negocio.
Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Abril 2012
texts.en:
Blanca makes a living from her small general store business, offering her customers a variety of products such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, eggs, and bread, among others.  She has had it for three years and with this income, in addition to the help of her husband, they have progressed with their children, who are attending school.  Due to her charisma and kindness, Blanca has a great number of customers.  Her business operates from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the night; she opens her general store every day of the week.     

Blanca is requesting a loan for the amount of 10,000 lempiras in order to invest in the purchase of soap, detergent, coffee, Maseca [brand corn meal], rice, juice, candy, sausages, beans and other products.  Blanca hopes that Prisma will support her with the loan because she needs to supply her business.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – April 2012

loans.use: to purchase soap, detergent, coffee, Maseca [brand corn meal], rice, juice, candy, sausages, beans and other products for her business.

loans.name: Licksi Albany

texts.es:
La señora Licksi, se dedica a su negocio de venta de Achinería como ser, aritos, pulseras, brillo, polvos, cremas,  tiene doce años de experiencia en esta actividad, así  mismo se dedica a la Venta de Ropa Usada de niño, ella labora para una empresa distribuidora de productos y tiene muchas clientes en los Supermercados y despensas de la ciudad, le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que desde pequeña con su mama se dedicaba a este negocio, Gracias a los ingresos que recibe puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la manutención de su pequeña hija.
Doña Licksi esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 6,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de cremas, maquillaje, brillos, polvos, glass, shampoo y acondicionador para poder ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.
Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Abril 2012
texts.en:
Licksi makes a living selling low-cost consumer goods such as earrings, bracelets, lip gloss, powders, and creams.  She has twelve years of experience in this business, while also making a living selling used children's clothes.  She works for a distribution company and has many customers in supermarkets and stores in the city.  She enjoys what she does, and has since she was young when she worked in this business with her mother.  Thanks to the income she receives, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses and support her young daughter.  

Licksi is asking for a loan of L. 6,000.00 to purchase creams, makeup, lip gloss, powders, nail polish, shampoo, and conditioner, so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – April 2012

loans.use: to purchase creams, makeup, nail polish, shampoo, and conditioner for her business.

loans.name: Nelson Nahun

texts.es:
Nelson Nahúm, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y reside en el municipio de Trojes. El inició con el negocio de elaboración de rótulos hace un año y medio y decidió hacerlo porque dibuja muy bien y sus vecinos lo buscaban siempre que tenían algún trabajo artístico que presentar en el colegio para que él se los hiciera de forma gratuita, luego pensó que podía aprovechar la oportunidad de negocio y comenzó a cobrar. Algunos años después con los ingresos que iba obteniendo pudo establecer una pequeña librería en un área de su casa de habitación. 
Nelson solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de libretas, cuadernos, lápices, pegamento, tijeras, colores, marcadores, reglas, productos para de higiene personal, etc. Su sueño es tener un local propio, amplio y bien acondicionado. Este es su primer préstamo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el compromiso de pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Nelson Nahúm is 27 years old, single and lives in the municipality of Trojes. He decided to start up in the sign making business a year and a half ago because he is very good at drawing. His neighbours would always look for him whenever they had any art homework for school so that he would do it for them for free. He then thought he could take advantage of this business and he began to charge them. Some years later with the profits he was getting, he was able to establish a little stationery store in part of his house. 

Nelson is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of notepads, notebooks, pencils, glue, scissors, colour pencils, felt tip pens, rulers, personal hygiene products, etc. His dream is to have his own shop, that is spacious and well equipped. This is his first loan with FAMA and he hopes to fulfill his repayment commitment on time.

loans.use: to buy notepads, notebooks, pencils, glue, scissors, colour pencils amongst other products.

loans.name: Sari Group

texts.es: Doña Baltazara tiene 52 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Sari, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, ella y sus hijos residen en la comunidad de Trojes, El Paraiso. Doña Baltazara inicio su negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 7 años, comenzó por iniciativa propia,  sus hijos le colaboran en atender la tienda de ropa y el negocio lo abre desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 pm y en su tiempo libre sale a vender de forma ambulante, es una familia luchadora, honesta y responsable. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para la compra de fardos de ropa con estilos que estén a la moda para así poder llamar la atención de sus clientes y de este modo pueda aumentar sus ventas. La vida económica de doña Baltazara ha cambiado considerablemente desde que recibe el apoyo de los préstamos de FAMA. Su meta es mejorar su casa para poder ampliar su negocio. Doña Baltazara ha sido clienta de FAMA desde hace varios años y ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Baltazara is 52 years old and a member of the Grupo Solidario Sari [Sari Solidarity Group]. She is also a single mother with four children. She and her children live in the Trojes community, El Paraiso. 

Baltazara started her business selling used clothing of her own initiative 7 years ago. Her children help her to operate the clothing shop, which is kept open between 8:00am to 5:00pm. During her free time she sells clothes as a street vendor. They are a family of real go-getters, honest and responsible.

She is asking for a loan to buy packs of clothing in contemporary styles so that she can attract customers and, in this way, increase her sales. Baltazara's financial situation has changed significantly since she received the support of FAMA's loans. Her goal is to improve her house so that she can expand her business. Baltazara has been a client of FAMA for many years and has made her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy packs of clothing

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor Manuel, tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, padre de 3 hijos y junto a su familia reside en el municipio de Trojes. 
Víctor se dedica a la agricultura y desde hace seis años también tiene una venta abarrotería en general en su casa de habitación, su esposa le ayuda a atender la pulpería mientras él se dedica a la agricultura desde las 5:00 am y culmina a las 12:00 pm. Su mayor ventaja es que solo él y su esposa tienen una pulpería en la comunidad y por eso sus ventas son buenas.
Víctor Manual solicita este préstamo para surtir su pulpería de más y variados productos como ser pan, pastas, salsas, condimentos, refrescos, galletas, churros, dulces, granos básicos entre otros productos de uso doméstico como escobas, mechas de trapeador, cloro, azistin y ace. 
Su sueño es ampliar el inventario de su negocio y acondicionarlo mejor para ofrecer a sus clientes un ambiente más agradable. Víctor es un buen cliente y espera cumplir puntualmente con el compromiso de pago de sus cuotas como lo ha venido haciendo.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel is 40 years old and is married with 3 children. He lives with his family in the municipality of Trojes. 

Víctor works in agriculture and for the last six years he has also sold general grocery products from his home. His wife helps him by serving in the grocery store while he farms from 5:00am to 12:00 pm. His greatest advantage is that he and his wife own the only grocery store in the community so he makes good sales. 

Víctor Manual is requesting this loan so that he can stock his grocery store with a greater variety of products, including bread, pastries, sauces, condiments, soft drinks, biscuits, churros, sweets and basic grains, along with other products for domestic use such as brooms, mop heads, bleach and  Azistin and Ace [cleaning products]. 

His dream is to expand his business's inventory and to equip it better so as to provide his customers with a more pleasant environment. Víctor is a good client and he hopes to continue to honour his loan repayments punctually as he has done so far.

loans.use: to buy general grocery store products.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero y reside en el municipio de Trojes. Él se dedica a la venta abarrotería en general en su casa de habitación, su horario de atención inicia a  las 6:00 am y culmina a las 7:00 pm. Su mayor ventaja es que tiene un carácter muy afable y sus vecinos prefieren comprar en su pulpería y por eso sus ventas son buenas.
Esteban solicita este préstamo para surtir su pulpería de más y variados productos como ser pan, pastas, salsas, condimentos, refrescos, galletas, churros, dulces, granos básicos entre otros productos de uso doméstico. 
Su sueño es ampliar el inventario de su negocio y las instalaciones para ofrecer a sus clientes un ambiente más agradable. Este es el primer préstamo de Esteban y espera cumplir puntualmente con el compromiso de pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Esteban is 37 years old. He is single and he lives in Trojes municipality. He makes a living in general store sales from his house. His business hours start at 6:00 am and end at 7:00 pm. His best advantage is that he has an affable character and his neighbors prefer to buy at his general store, and that's why he has good sales. 

Esteban is applying for this loan to stock his general store with more and varied products like bread, pastas, salsas, condiments, sodas, cookies, churros (fried dough), candies, and basic grains among other household products. His dream is to expand the inventory and facilities of his business to offer his clients a more pleasant ambiance. This is Esteban's first loan and he hopes to punctually comply with the commitment to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy general store goods

loans.name: Tilita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tilita lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María del Socorro quien se dedica al comercio de especies (canela, clavo de olor, pimienta…etc.) desde hace 10 años. Además tiene un molino desde hace 17 años con lo cual logro sacar a delante a sus hijos de los cuales uno de ellos es quien le ayuda en el negocio junto a  su nieto.
Las otras personas son Rosa Amanda quien vende ropa desde hace 6 años, Concepción del Socorro de 40 años comercializa granos básicos y María Sebastiana desde hace 10  años vende sopas y tortillas.
texts.en:
The Tilita group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women.  One of them is Maria de Socorro, who has made a living selling spices (cinnamon, clove, pepper, etc.) for ten years.  For 17 years she has also had a mill with which she has managed to help her children get ahead in life.  One of them, along with her grandson, helps her in the business.

The other women are Rosa Amanda, who has sold clothing for six years; Concepción del Socorro, 40 years old, who sells basic grains; and María Sebastiana who has sold soup and tortillas for ten years.

loans.use: to buy spices like cinnamon, clove, achote, etc.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 53 years old and is a single woman. She lives in San Mariano town and has a grocery store where she sells different products to customers. 

Nelia is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of products such as sugar, soap, shampoo, and spices. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, attract more customers, and make more income.

loans.use: to buy spices, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and sugar for her store

loans.name: Los Chilamates Group

texts.es:
El grupo los chilamates lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Maria quien se dedica al comercio de reposterías (cosa de horno, donas, empanadas) desde hace 4 años aproximadamente. Ella tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad de los cuales su hija es quien le ayuda en el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Patricia quien vende repostería y ropa usada desde hace 7 años y Rosa quien desde hace 13 años realiza bocadillos y reposterías las cuales comercializa de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The Chilamates Group consists of three entrepreneurial, hard-working women, one of whom is Maria.  Maria has sold pastries (baked goods, donuts, empanadas) for approximately 4 years.  She has three adult children and her daughter helps her with her business.

The other members of the group include Patricia who has sold pastries and used clothing for 7 years, and Rosa who is a street vendor and has sold sandwiches and pastries for 13 years.

loans.use: to buy pastries

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Ibrahim from Krootown central area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with two children ages 3 and 5 years. One of his children is currently attending school. He also has a parent living with him.

In 2008, Ibrahim established his clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to improve his status; before that he was a driver. He works at the business six days per week. His other source of income comes from his inheritance of his parent's house, but that is not enough to take care of his family so he went out to take a loan from BRAC. He describes his biggest problems as insufficient capital to invest in large business.

Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy more clothing items such as jeans, trousers, ladies' bags, t-shirts, and ladies' dresses. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to expand his business and educate his children. In the future, Ibrahim plans to be an international business man. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing items such as jeans, trousers, ladies' bags, t-shirts and ladies' dresses.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Issa from Grassfield, an eastern area in Freetown. He is a father of 1 daughter, aged 12 years. His daughter is currently attending school. Issa began this business because it had been his childhood dream to become a businessman.

Issa runs a business selling local food commodities. He sells palm oil, groundnuts, rice, cassava and beans. He has been running this business for 7 years. He works at the business 7 days a week. His business is the only source of income he has. Issa is facing the problem of the rainy season. 

Issa has requested a loan in order to buy more local food commodities such as palm oil, groundnuts, rice, cassava and beans. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his daughter. In the future, he plans to expand his business to wholesaler. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more local food commodities such as palm oil, groundnuts, rice, cassava and beans.

loans.name: Telebeh

texts.en:
Telebeh is 30 years old and single with no children for now. He runs a food stuff business in Tengbeh town western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is very hard-working. He works in the business 7 days per week, 11 hours a day.

He's been in this business for 10 years and sells onions and garlic. He also earns income from small-scale farming in the village. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high price of transportation costs.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more bags of onions and garlic onions. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him change his standard of living. In the future, he would like to expand his business and open more stores. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of onions and garlic onions.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 32 years old and married a teacher; they are blessed with two children ages 2 years and 4 years. For the past 12 years, Mohamed has been running a provision shop in a busy market. He also has two additional dependents that live with him at home.

He began this because he needed a permanent source of income to support his family. He sells bread, eggs, milk, toothpaste, and other items. He also earns income from transportation of taxi. At present he is faced with the problem of increase in fuel prices.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more bread, eggs, milk, toothpaste, and other items. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to educate his children. In the future, he would like to open a car center. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bread, eggs, milk, toothpaste, and other items.

loans.name: Khawla Group

texts.en:
The members of the "Khawla" group are all married women; they are Najmh, Zahrah, Rabah, Abeer, Hasibh, Hmam and Hajr. They all live in Sana`a, Yemen. They know each other through friendship and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 130,000 YER. 

Rabah is the leader of the group and is 42 years old. (She is the woman holding the brown dress) She's been selling ladies' clothes for 2 years. She says that she does very well with the business. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She hopes that she'll do better and will use the loan to buy dresses, fabrics, skirts, etc. She is happy and hopes to get a lot out of the loan. She hopes the business will continue growing like it's done to date. She is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy dresses, fabrics, skirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Wejdan

texts.en:
Wejdan is a 36-year-old woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She has a home-based project selling cosmetics products, which provides an additional source of income to her family.
Wejdan is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase cosmetics products for trading purposes. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products for trading purposes.

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is a 29-year-old single man from Al Zarqa, Jordan.
Majdi has a small flower shop. He is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to expand his business and purchase more flowers for trading purposes. Majdi is looking to have more employees at his shop to help him. He is also looking to save an adequate amount of income to have it ready for when he gets married.
As Majdi is under 30 years old, his loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase flowers for trading purposes.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 20-year-old single lady from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan.
Zeinab sells clothes and is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase her income.
As Zeinab is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha is a 23-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan. She has a home-based micro-project selling accessories. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase more accessories for trading purposes. In the future, Nuha is looking to purchase her own car.
As Nuha is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.
Nuha is a conservative person who does not wish to upload her picture to the internet so the man shown in the photo is her husband.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for trading purposes.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 21-year-old single man from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan.
Hani has a small shop selling mobile phones and he is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more mobiles for trading purposes. In the future, Hani is looking to expand his shop.
As Hani is under 30 years old, his loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones for trading purposes.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 31-year-old married man from Idon, Irbid, Jordan.
Amer has a barber shop and he is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to purchase equipment needed for expansion purposes. He is looking to improve his business and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for expansion purposes.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Abla is a 44-year-old married woman from Nao'or, Jordan. She supports seven members of her family. Abla is looking to improve her family's living conditions and is therefore requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to do maintenance work on her house.
Abla is a conservative person who does not wish to upload her picture to the internet so the man shown in the photo is her son.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on her house.

loans.name: Eslam

texts.en:
Eslam is a 23-year-old married woman. She lives in Jabal Al-Hussein, Amman, Jordan. She is a mother of one child.
Eslam is requesting a loan of 500 JOD in order to buy more cosmetics and perfumes for trading purposes. In the future she is looking to have her own store.
Eslam is under 30 years old so her loan is consider as a youth loan. 
Eslam is a conservative woman who does not wish to upload her photo to the internet, so the photo shows her husband.

loans.use: Cosmetics & perfums sales

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is 32 years old and married. She lives in Irbid, Jordan. Nada is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to buy more clothes for trading so she can improve her social and living level.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Maha is 31 years old and married. She is a mother of two children and lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Maha is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to buy more baby clothes to sell so she can open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes for trading

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Randa is 24 years old, married and lives in Sahab, Jordan.

Randa is looking to have a loan of 1000 JOD to fix the bathrooms in her house. In the future, she will fix more stuff in her home to make it more comfortable for her family.

Randa is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve and fix her home

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Ahlam is 29 years old, married and a mother of three children. She lives in Sahab. Jordan.

Ahlam is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to buy electronic machines for her home. She wants to improve the living conditions.
In the future, Ahlam is looking to buy her own car.

Ahlam is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 27-year-old married woman. She is a conservative woman, unwilling to upload her photo on internet, so the photo is of her husband. Rasha is the mother of two children. She lives in Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan.

Rasha is looking for a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars so she can buy clothes for trading purposes. The income of her family will increase and she can build her own home in the future. Rasha is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Hana'a

texts.en:
Hana'a is a 43-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children. Hana'a lives in Irbid, Jordan.

Hana'a is looking for a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars so she can improve her living conditions and buy some furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home

loans.name: Zareefeh

texts.en:
Zareefeh is 35 years old and married with four children. She lives in Irbid, Jordan.

Zareefeh is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to buy more cosmetics and perfume for trading purposes. With this loan, her income will increase.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 38 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Maryam is looking to have a loan of 1,500 JOD to expand her project (business) making milk products by buying more raw materials. In the future, she would like to open her own store.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make milk products

loans.name: Mohammad Sultan

texts.en:
Mohammad Sultan is 33 years old and married. He lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Mohammad Sultan is looking to have a loan of 800 JOD to improve his house living conditions and fix it to be healthier.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is 54 years old and married with three children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Najah is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to buy more clothes for trading purposes.

Najah is looking to own a clothes store in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is 50 years old and married with three children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Hiyam is looking to have a loan of 700 JOD to buy more clothes to sell. She wants to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is 40 years old and single. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Abeer is looking to have a loan of 600 JOD to buy more goods for general trading. In the future, she is looking to open her own store.

loans.use: to buy goods for general trading

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 47 years old, married and a mother of five children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Nadia is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to improve her house living conditions by making repairs.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 53 years old, divorced and a mother of one child. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Fatima is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to buy more blankets for trading. She wants to open her own store and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Mathayel

texts.en:
Mathayel is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Mathayel is 29 years old, married and a mother of two children. She lives in Sahab, Jordan.

Mathayel is looking to have a loan of 1,000 JOD to buy more cosmetics and perfumes for trading so her income will increase.

Mathayel is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfume to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is married to Joana.  They had been blessed with three children.  Ronald is a farmer who has been farming in the Philippines for 15 years.

Ronald is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings to support his rice production efforts.  Ronald hopes this loan will help him grow his operation.  Currently, Ronald earns 35,000 PHP every harvest season in this field of work.  He is determined to work hard to provide for his family, and hopes that Kiva will continue to provide financial assistance so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings to support his rice production efforts.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 27-year-old man about to get married. He lives in Irbid, Jordan, and one person is dependent on him.

Abdullah is looking to have a loan of 1500 JOD to pay for his marriage preparation expenses so he can start a new life with his future wife.

Abdullah is under 30 years old so his loan is considered as a  youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his marriage preparation expenses

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 24-year-old married woman; she lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.

Amal is looking to have a loan of 300 JOD so she can improve her household living conditions and fix up her house so it will be more healthy.

Amal is under 30 years old so her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve her household living conditions

loans.name: Roqaya

texts.en:
Roqaya is looking for a loan of 300 Jordanian dinars so she can improve her living conditions and fix her house to be more suitable and healthy to live in. Roqaya is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. 

Roqaya is a conservative woman, unwilling to upload her photo on internet, so the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to fix and improve her house.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is looking for a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars so she can buy more foodstuffs for trading. Her income will increase accordingly. Muna is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.

Muna is a conservative woman, unwilling to upload her photo on internet, so the photo is of her son.

loans.use: to do food trade

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer is looking for a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to buy more goods for general trading. Her income will increase and she hopes to open a place in her home to use for trading. Ghadeer is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

loans.use: to buy goods for general trading

loans.name: Maysa'a

texts.en:
Maysa'a is a conservative woman and she is unwilling to upload her photo on the Internet. The photo is of her husband.

Maysa'a is 28 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She lives in Sahab, Jordan.

Maysa'a is looking to have a loan of 800 JOD so she can buy some new furniture for her home. She hopes to expand her home area in the future.

Maysa'a is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy some new furniture for her home.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia lives in Buluk. She sells clothes and has been in the business for 5 years. She is 42 years old, married, and has six children; all of them are still in school. 

Fozia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fifth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 4,000 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for 2 years. She is 28 years old, single, and has no children. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Buluk. She sells food from a stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 36 years old, married, and has six children; five of them are still in school. Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material for her straw crafts.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 21-year-old single man who lives in Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan.

Hamzeh is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so he can expand his project in fixing mobile phones, hardware and software.

Hamzeh is looking to open his own store in the future.

Hazmeh is under 30 years old so his loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to expand his project in mobile phone, software and hardware repair.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Buluk. She operates a food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Esther heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in Buluk. She sells fish and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Lilian heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a 34-year-old single woman. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Majd is looking to have a loan of 600 JOD so she can buy more cosmetics, perfumes and clothes for trading. She wants to open her her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and cosmetics for trading.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 46-year-old married woman. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Majeda is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so she can buy more household appliances and food for trading purposes from her home. She would like to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy household appliances and food for trading purposes.

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en:
Wedad is a 47-year-old married woman who is a mother of four children. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Wedad is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD so she can repair her house and buy some new furniture for it. In the future, she hopes to build more rooms to make the house more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to repair and fix her home and buy some furniture.

loans.name: Hayfa

texts.en:
Hayfa is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Hayfa is looking to have a loan of 600 JOD so she can buy more clothes for trading purposes. She would like to open her own store in the future and increase her income to protect the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a conservative woman and she is unwilling to upload her photo on the Internet. The photo is of her husband.

Hala is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives in Irbid, Jordan.

Hala is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD so she can buy more clothes for trading purposes. Her social and commercial level will be better.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: Salah is a 60-year-old married man. He is the father of four children. He lives in Irbid, Jordan. Salah is looking for a loan of 800 Jordanian dinars so he can buy more material for his hookah business, so his income will increase.

loans.use: to buy material for a hookah (hubbly bubbly) business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe  DANAYA   sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Aoua fait le commerce  d’igname à travers ce groupe de femmes de  DANAYA  elle se tient à l’extrême droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 7 sacs d’ignames auprès des grossistes, qu’elle revend en détail au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the DANAYA group are married women with an average age of 35 years, and an average of 5 children. They live in monogamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso. 
They are requesting their second loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.
Aoua trades yams through the DANAYA group of women. She is standing on the far right of the photo. 
She plans to use the loan to buy 7 bags of yams from wholesalers that she can sell retail at the market and from her home for cash to a customer base consisting mostly of women. 
She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, a portion of which will be used to pay back the loan with interest, while the rest will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Khawla is 23 years old and married. She lives in Idon, Irbid, Jordan. She is a mother of one child.

Khawla is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to expand her project by buying computer parts to sell so the family's income will increase.

Khawla is under 30 years old and married so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to sell computer parts

loans.name: Gnogondeme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe GNOGONDEME  sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques à  Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
MAMOU fait le commerce d’oignon dans ce groupe de femmes de   GNOGONDEME, elle se tient à l’extrême droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 3sacs de 50 kg d’oignon avec les grossistes qu’elle revendra en détail au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the GNOGONDEME group are married women with an average age of 36 years, and an average of 5 children each. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali. 
They are requesting their third loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.
MAMOU is one of the members of the GNOGONDEME group of women. She sells onions and is standing on the far right of the photo. 
She plans to use the loan to buy three 50 kilo bags of onions from wholesalers that she can sell at retail price at the market and from her home for cash to a customer base consisting mostly of women. 
She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, a portion of which will be used to pay back the loan with interest, while the rest will be put into savings.

loans.use: To buy onions

loans.name: Ebtsam

texts.en:
Ebtsam is 50 years old, divorced woman and a mother of one child. She lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.

Ebtsam is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to buy more blankets for trading purposes. She thinks of expanding her project in the future to cover more areas to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Asma'a

texts.en:
Asma'a is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Asma'a is 24 years old, married and a mother of two children. She lives in Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan.

Asma'a is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to improve her living conditions and repair her house so it will be more comfortable.

Asma'a is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve and repair her house

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 44 years old and married. She is a mother of two children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Mariam is looking to have a loan of 700 JOD to buy more cleaning materials for trading purposes. She hopes in the future to be able to open her own store to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning materials to sell

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is 44 years old and married. She is a mother of five children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Najah is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to improve her home living conditions and do repairs to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
MOUGNOU  est un groupe constitué essentiellement de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
AMINTA fait le commerce de savon dans ce groupe de femmes de MOUGNOU elle se tient à l’extrême droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 10 cartons de savon auprès des grossistes qu’elle revend en détail, au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
MOUGNOU is a group consisting mainly of married women with an average age of 30 years, who have on average 3 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is requested in order to help them meet the needs of their customers.
AMINTA trades soap. In the MOUGNOU group of women she is standing on the far right of the photo. 
She plans to use the loan to buy 10 boxes of soap from wholesalers that she can sell retail at the market and from her home for cash to a customer base consisting mostly of women. 
She expects to make an average monthly profit of 12,500 FCFA, a portion of which will be used to pay back the loan with interest, while the rest will be put into savings.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  SABALY sont  de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans,  4 enfants et vivant la majoritairement  dans des  familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles.
Aminata fait le commerce  d’orange  dans ce groupe de femmes ,  elle est à l’extrême gauche sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 20 sacs d’orange  avec les paysans producteurs .Elle revend en détail sur place au marché en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabaly group are married women, who average 35 years of age with four children each; the majority of them live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso, the Republic of Mali's third administrative region. 

They are on their second loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customers' needs.

Within this group of women, Aminata sells oranges; she is on the far left of the photo.

With her loan she is planning to buy 20 sacks of oranges from the peasants who produce them. She resells on a retail basis and for cash at the local market and within her family, to a customer base made up mainly of women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, of which part will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it, and the rest saved.

loans.use: to buy oranges

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe   DEMBAGNOUMA  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier Babemba de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
KOROTOUMOU fait le commerce  de  céréales  dans ce groupe de femmes de   DEMBAGNOUMA   elle se tient en deuxième position a partir de la gauche sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 1 sacs de riz qu’elle revend en détail au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 8 000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the DEMBAGNOUMA group are all married women, with an average age of 45, and an average of 5 children each. They live in monogamous families in the Babemba neighborhood, in the city of Sikasso.
This is their first loan with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which will help them meet the needs of their customers.
KOROTOUMOU, a member of the DEMBAGNOUMA group of women, sells grains. She is second from the left in the photo. 
With her loan, she plans to buy 1 sack of rice which she will resell on a cash basis at the market and among her family members to customers who are mostly women. 
She expects to make an average monthly profit of 8,000 CFA francs, of which some will be used to repay the loan and the interest, and the rest put aside as savings.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Kankeletigui Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe    KANKELETIGUI   sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames, au quartier Babemba de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
HABY fait le commerce  de friperies dans ce groupe de femmes, elle se tient au milieu sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 2 balles de friperies auprès des grossistes qu’elle revend en détail  en famille et en ambulant à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 34 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The five members of group Kankeletigui are married women; they are on average 45 year-old with five children. They live in monogamous families, in the Babemba district of the city of Sikasso.
To meet customer demand, they are on their first loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.
Among these women, Haby is in the used clothes business; she is standing in the middle of the photo.
With her loan, she is planning on purchasing two bundles of second-hand clothes from wholesalers, to be retailed with her family and door-to-door to a clientele composed mainly of women who pay in cash.
She is expecting an average monthly profit of 34,000 FCFA. Part of it will be used to repay the loan with its interest, while the remainder will go to her savings.
Her ambition is to increase sales and better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Sanouya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  SANOUYA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier Babemba de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Matou fait le commerce  de haricot  dans ce groupe de femmes de  SANOUYA  elle est  à l’extrême gauche sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 sacs de haricot auprès des grossistes qu’elle revendra en détail en famille  et dans le marché à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the SANOUYA group are married women.  They have an average age of 30 and have, on average, two children each.  They live mainly in monogamous families in the Babemba neighborhood of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

These women are taking out their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' needs.

Matou's business is selling beans.  She is the woman on the far left of the photo.

Matou plans to use her loan to buy two sacks of beans from wholesalers.  She will re-sell the produce retail among her family members and also in the market.  She sells to a customer base made up mostly of women.  She sells for cash.

Matou plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs.  She will use some of the money to repay her loan and interest and will save the rest.

loans.use: to buy beans

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe    BENKADI   sont  de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et ont en moyenne  7 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier Médine un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
AWA fait le commerce  de TOMATE dans ce groupe de femmes de BENKADI , elle se tient en première position à partir de la droite. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 50 paniers de tomates auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle revendra en détail sur place et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the BENKADI group are married women who average 45 years of age and 7 children each.  Most of them live in monogamous families in Medine, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

In order to satisfy the needs of their customers, they have requested their tenth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  Awa is the member of the BENKADI group who sells tomatoes.  In the photo, she is the first woman from the right.

With her loan, she is planning to buy 50 baskets of tomatoes from rural producers.  She will resell her goods locally, within her family, for retail and for cash, to a customer base essentially made up of women.

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 45,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to pay off her loan and interest, while the rest will be put into savings.  Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Soumaila

texts.fr:
Soumaila est né vers 1980. Il est père de 5 enfants et vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le village de Fogolasso dans la commune rurale de Missirikoro Région de Sikasso.
Soumaila, fait comme activité la vente de céréales il y’a environ 10 ans. Ses articles  sont composés de mil, maïs, riz, arachide, fonio,n etc. 
Nanti de 10 ans d’expériences  dans le domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. Ainsi, il intègre Soro Yiriwaso cette année. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il  sollicite ce prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter 15 sacs de mil, 10sacs de maïs, quelque kilos de noix d’acajou 
ll s’approvisionne dans les villages de  Missirikoro , Fogolasso, kapala etc. Les  céréales ainsi achetées sont stockées dans son  magasin à Fogolasso. Ses ventes se font en gros, en détail et au comptant. Sa clientèle st mixte    
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA par mois. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Soumaila was born around 1980.  He is the father of five children and he lives with his wife and children in the village of Fogolasso, located in the rural commune of Missirikoro, in the Sikasso region.

Soumaila has been selling grains for about ten years.  He sells millet, maize, rice, groundnuts, fonio etc.  Thanks to his ten-year experience in this field, he enjoys a good reputation and receives many orders, but the necessary resources to meet his needs are lacking.  This is why he has joined Soro Yiriwaso this year.

In order to better satisfy the needs of a growing number of customers, he is requesting this loan which will enable him to buy 15 bags of millet, 10 bags of maize and a few kilos of cashew nuts.  He buys his goods in the villages of Missirikiro, Fogolasso, Kapala etc.  Once purchased, his grains are stored in his shop in Fogolasso.  He sells in bulk, for retail and for cash.  His customer base consists of both men and women.

With this loan, Soumaila is expecting monthly profits to reach 85,000 CFA francs.  With these profits, he is planning to take care of his family expenditures and cover most of his personal expenses.  He will also pay off his loan's interest and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
AMINATA est née vers 1980, est mère de 4 enfants et vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Ziekorodougou, un des village de la commune urbaine de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Aminata, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment le commerce de pagnes et des parures, s’est vite initiée aux activités de stockage et commercialisation de céréales (mil, maïs, riz, etc.), il y a environ 4 ans. Elle a une grande expérience dans le domaine et jouit d’une forte réputation, elle accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. Ainsi, elle intégra Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Tous les  prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle a sollicité ce nouveau  prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter, 5 sacs de mil et 5 sacs de maïs. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les village de : Tiongonbougou, Heremakono, Kolokoba. Les céréales ainsi achetées sont stockées dans son  magasin à Ziekorodougou. Ses ventes se font en gros, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composées de consommateurs et revendeurs.    
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour ses dépenses personnelles, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aminata was born around 1980. She is the mother of four children, and lives with her husband and children in Ziekorodougou, a village in the urban area of Sikasso (the third admistrative region of Mali). After trying several types of business activities without success, such as selling traditional fabrics and jewelry, four years ago Aminata launched a business storing and selling cereals (millet, corn, rice etc).
