She has a lot of experience in this area and enjoys a good business reputation. She receives many orders, but lacks the necessary resources to satisfy all requests. She has been a member of Soro Yiriwaso for three yars. All prior loans have been duly repaid.

Wishing to better meet the growing customer demand, she is seeking a new loan, which will allow her to buy five bags of millet and five bags of corn. She stocks up in the villages of Tiongonbougou, Heremakono, and Kolokoba. She stocks cereals in her warehouse in Ziekorodougou. She sells wholesale and retail, for cash, to a customer base composed of both consumers and vendors. With this loan, she plans to achieve an average monthly income of 65,000 West African Francs, which will be used for her personal needs, her family’s needs, and the interest on her loan, and the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol (in the photo) is 52 years old and she and her husband, Kong, live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters.  

Thol and her husband have been selling soy milk for almost 20 years. They produce soy milk by themselves. Their two daughters assist their parents by carrying soy milk by bicycle to sell in their village and nearby villages. 

Thol wants to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her daughters to use to carry soy milk for sale, so she decided to apply for a loan. With a motorbike and a trailer which she will buy with money from the loan, it will be much easier than with the bicycle. Furthermore, Thol’s daughters will be able to carry a lot of soy milk to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her daughters to use to transport soy milk for sale.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent home. He has been operating a retail shop for the last six years and faces a hardship of inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and has applied for a loan to help him buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt for resale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise  such as sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard believes that his hard work will enable him to improve their living status because he is living with his parents.He is 28 years of age and single.

Bernard has been a farmer for almost 12 years, with the long period of cultivating his one hectare of rice field, he is able to support his family needs. Poverty has pushed him to strive hard to succeed. He would like to improve the growth of his rice crop and with the farm plot to be able to obtain plentiful harvest this next crop season. 

So, he would like to provide necessary farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides but his capital is not enough due to the high cost of basic commodities and expensive price of said farm inputs.To realize his goals, he is asking for the loan amount of P40,000. He hopes that he can access financial services continually to further cover his family needs and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to maintain his farming business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 28-year-old, ambitious woman living in Hioma, Uganda.  She is a teacher by profession and has been in service for three years. 

In order to supplement her monthly salary, she decided to venture into the transportation sector by buying a motorcycle.  The main challenge she faces is the inconsistency of the hired cyclist to remit the agreed percentage of his daily earnings to her.  Her dream is to buy another motorcycle because the business is profitable despite the challenges. Therefore, Agnes is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is 35 years old and married. He is a father of one child and lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Kamel is looking for a loan of 1,500 JOD to buy more quantities of shoes for trading purposes. He wishes in the future to open his own store and home.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 31 years old and single. Four family members depend on her. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Fatima is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to buy more quantities of clothes for trading purposes. She hopes to open her own store in the future to improve her living conditions and level.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is 23 years old and married. She is a mother of three children and lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Muna is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to buy more quantities of clothes for trading purposes. She wants to open her own store and increase her income.

Muna is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mas'odah

texts.en:
Mas'odah is 55 years old and married with one child. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Mas'odah is looking to have a loan of 600 JOD to buy more quantities of clothing for trading. She wants to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ebtsam

texts.en:
Ebtsam is 32 years old and married. She is a mother of seven children and she lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Ebtsam is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to can buy more quantities of clothes for trading. She wants to open her own store in the future and to improve her living level.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en:
Hamda is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on internet. The photo is of her son.

Hamda is 58 years old and married with four children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Hamda is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to improve her house living conditions and make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to improve her house living conditions

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is 47 years old and married with four children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Sahar is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to expand her project by buying more quantities of cosmetics & perfumes so she can open her own shop in the future and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is 32 years old and married. She is a mother of one child and lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Rania is looking to have a loan of 600 JOD to make repairs to improve her home living conditions.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home

loans.name: Awdah

texts.en:
Awdah is 36 years old and a married man. He is a father of five children and lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Awdah is looking to have a loan of 700 JOD to repair his home to make it more comfortable and healthier for his family.

loans.use: to repair his home

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is 22 years old and married with one child. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Ruba is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to buy more raw materials to make cheese and to buy olives to make olive oil. She wants to expand her work and increase her income.

Ruba is under 30 years old, so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make cheese and oil

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 69 years old and married. She is a mother of three children and lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Aisha is looking to have a loan of 600 JOD to buy more quantities of clothes for trading. She wants to open her own shop in the future and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 35 years old and married. He is a father of three children and he lives in Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan.

Saleh is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to improve his house living conditions by making some repairs and buying the new furniture he needs. His social and living level will be better.

loans.use: to repair his house and buy furntiure

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is looking for a loan of 600 Jordanian dinars so he can improve his living conditions by painting his home and increasing its size by building an additional room. In the future, Hani wants to build a new floor above his home.

Hani is a 29-year-old single man. He lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan. He is under 30 years old so his loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve his house living conditions

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is looking for a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars so she can improve her living conditions by repairing her home and providing new paint for it because the walls are very wet. Eman wants to make her home healthier for her family and she hopes she can buy her own home in the future.

Eman is a 40-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six children. They live in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

loans.use: to improve her home living conditions

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 40 years old, married and the father of six children. He lives in Jabal Al Hussain, Amman, Jordan.

Khaled is looking to have a loan of 1500 JOD to license his business in transportation (taxi) and to buy a piece of land.

In the future, he wants to buy more taxis for transportation.

loans.use: to license his transportation business and buy a piece of land

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: Massa lives in Airport.  She is 44 years old, married, and has four children between 11 and 22 years old.  They are in school and live at home.  Her husband works with Firestone.  For the past 15 years, Massa has been selling door lack, nails, door inches, and other items in the market.  She started this business by selling used clothes for her mother and learned this way of selling from her mother,   She is requesting a loan to buy more door lock, nails, door hinges and others items for her business.  Her plan is to expand her business and see her children out of high school.

loans.use: to buy more door lock, nails, door hinges and others items for her business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammed is 24 years old and single. Three members of his family depend on him. He lives in Jabal Al Hussain, Amman, Jordan.

Mohammed is looking to have a loan of 1,000 JOD to buy more quantities of cosmetics to sell in the beauty salon where he works. He wishes to have his own beauty salon in the future to increase his income.

Mohammed is under 30 years old so his loan is a youth loan

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Laila is 48 years old, married and lives in Sahab, Jordan.

Laila is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to make repairs to improve her home living conditions..

loans.use: to make repairs to her house

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Amal is 24 years old and married. She lives in Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan.

Amal is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to make repairs to her home so it will be more comfortable. She also wants to expand the area of her home. 

Amal is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo to the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Khawla is 50 years old and married with three children. She lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan.

Khawla is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to improve her home by buying furniture and curtains so it will look more beautiful and be more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to buy furniture and curtains for her home

loans.name: Jose Eulalio

texts.es:
El señor Jose Eulalio esta casado, tiene 39 años de edad, cursó los años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura y a la tejeduría, inicio la tejeduría por necesidad de superación y hasta el momento lleva 19 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos y así mejorar su producción de tejido, espera en el futuro ampliar mas su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose Eulalio is 39 and married, He has finished elementary school and he has a son who is studying. 

He makes his living in agriculture and weaving. He started weaving out of necessity and drive to improve and so far he has 19 years experience.

Jose Eulalio requests a loan that he will use to buy threads and thus improve his weaving. He hopes in the future to expand his busines and improve his profits.

loans.use: to buy threads for weaving

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 30 años, vive con Ulises, el padre de sus dos hijos (de 12 y 7 años). Habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Huasahuasi en Tarma.

Hace dos años que su economía mejoró gracias a la inversión y al esfuerzo que puso en la actividad que realiza. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niña, ahora que ya tiene familia propia se desenvuelve con mayor ahínco. Ulises la apoya en estas cansadas labores, ya casi 10 años. Sus principales cultivos constan de arveja, papa y maíz; los cuales comercializa a un buen precio en el mercado mayorista de su distrito y de la ciudad, a donde viaja después de cada cosecha. Gracias a la agricultura pudo obtener los cuatro terrenos cultivables que posee, como también dos toros de buena raza, con los cuales ara la tierra. “Me gusta trabajar en el campo, porque es lo que sé hacer bien”, comenta muy orgullosa. Para el futuro desea mejorar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Éste sería su crédito número 2 con MFP y desde que formó parte del banco comunal “Unión Huanchán” sus labores van mejorando, ya que confía en su grupo para cualquier urgencia que se le presente.
Con el dinero que solicita ahora Norma podrá comprar dos bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 1100 soles. Lo restante lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Norma is 30 years old.  She lives with Ulises, the father of her two children (12 and 7 years old).  They live in their own house in Tarma’s Huasahuasi District. 

Two years ago her economy improved thanks to the investment and the effort she put into the activity she does.  She’s been in agriculture since she was a little girl.  Now that she has a family of her own she works with even more dedication.  Ulises supports her with these demanding tasks; it’s been almost ten years.

Her main crops are peas, potatoes and corn that she sells for a good price at her district’s and her city’s wholesale markets that she goes to after each harvest.  Thanks to agriculture she was able to obtain the four parcels of farmland she owns as well as two bulls of good pedigree that she uses to till the soil.  “I like to work in the fields because it’s what I know how to do well,” she comments very proudly.  For the future she’d like to improve the quality and quantity of her products.

This would be loan #2 with MFP.  Since she became part of the “Unión Huanchán” communal bank her work has been improving because she can rely on her group whenever some urgent need arises.

Norma  will use the money she’s requesting now to buy two sacks of pea seeds for 1100 soles; she will use the rest to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jhon Alexis

texts.es:
Jhon es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha buscado que su esposa y su hijo de 10 años de edad tengan la mejor calidad de vida posible. Es por esto que se esfuerza diariamente en su negocio para poder generar los ingresos con los cuales sea suficiente tener una buena estabilidad económica. En su bar, Jhon ofrece una gran variedad de productos, lo que hace que su negocio se diferencie de los demás y así pueda tener una gran clientela. Pese a esto, presenta la dificultad del poco capital disponible, por esto busca que un préstamo le permita comprar variedad de licores para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes un buen servicio.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá prestando un buen servicio y así podrá tener mejores ventas, lo que le permitirá tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Jhon sueña con tener un gran negocio con el que pueda brindarle a su hijo una estabilidad económica que en un futuro le permita progresar.
texts.en:
Jhon is a very hardworking person who has always tried to achieve the best possible quality of life for his wife and 10 year old son. It is for this reason that he works hard in his business every day so that he can generate the necessary income to have good economic stability. 

In his bar, Jhon offers a wide variety of products, which makes his business stand out from the others and brings him a large clientele. In spite of this, he experiences difficulty due to a lack of available capital, and this is why he is looking for a loan which will allow him to buy a variety of spirits to be able to continue offering a good service to his customers. In this way, his business will continue to offer a good service and he will increase his sales, which will allow him to take home more money and enjoy a better quality of life. 

Jhon dreams of having a large business through which he can offer his son the economic stability which will allow him to make progress in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spirits so that he can continue to offer a good service to his customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Buluk. She sells tea and has been in business for 5 years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase sugar and tea leaves. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en: Felipa is a single mother who is meeting her child's needs alone through her grocery business in the public market. She has been operating this business for four years and is thankful because it is gaining profit. With Felipa's strong management, the business is growing and is slowly become more well-known. Felipa is in need of additional capital in order to meet the demands of her customers. With a loan of P20,000, Felipa will stock her store with more groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, candy, shampoo, soap and detergent. She is hoping that with the help of the loan, she can save enough money to educate her child and further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, candy, shampoo, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Jacklina

texts.en:
Jacklina lives in Buluk. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for 5 years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Jacklina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1400 Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onion for resale.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy lives in Buluk. She sells ice cream and has been in business for 4 years. She is 34 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Joy heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad, aged 52, is an owner of a small store in the village. For the past 5 years of operating this business, she has been reducing the burden of financial problems. She could then provide food every day for her four children, but her income every day is not enough to promote the education of her four children. 

Because of this matter, she is seeking additional working capital to improve her business. A loan of PHP 15,000 would be a great help in developing her business and income. It will be used to buy biscuits, eggs, snacks and shampoo. In the future, Natividad hopes to maximize her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, eggs, snacks and shampoo

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is proud to be a farmer because through the income generated from his farming business, he is able to supply his family's needs. Mario is 48 years old, married, and has two children. The eldest is married while the youngest is still a college student.

Farming has been the main source of income for Mario's family. With the income generated from his farming business, he was able to buy a motorcycle and hogs to be raised. With the help of his wife, they are able to improve their three businesses. Mario grows rice crop on his 1.2 hectares of farm land. He also spends his other time raising his three boars and 30 piglets to make more income. Mario wakes up early in the morning to feed his raised hogs and after feeding them, he uses motorcycle transport for his daily travel going to and from the market. He is really a man of full of hopes and he is industrious. His income from his hog-raising was used to cover all his children's school fees, allowances, and some was used for repair and maintenance of his house.

With his dream to educate his youngest child, he is asking for additional working capital in the amount of PHP 30,000. He will be using this loan amount to buy farm supplies and pay for irrigation fees of his farming business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay for irrigation fees of his farming business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Due to the family's financial burden, Elma is involved in the hog-raising business to help her husband generate income. She is now 49 and has four grown children. With the help of her husband, they are able to send their children to school. They want to educate all their children so that they will earn a degree and become professionals in the future. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Elma planned to raise more pigs to sell in the future.

To work out her plan, she is requesting PHP 12,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that this loan will enable her to work out her plan and hopes that she will become successful in carrying out her plans.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a hardworking woman who very much wishes to get ahead of life. She engaged herself in sewing dresses and curtains as a source of income. This business helps her to cover some of the household needs and provide daily food for her four children.

She wants to maximize her business to offer a variety of dresses and curtains, but lack of capital hinders her dream. This is why she needs a new loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy rolls of fabric to increase production and variety of dresses. She hopes this will lead to higher sales and good income for the improvement of her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Vilma is engaged in the hog-raising business to generate additional income. She is now 51 years old and was blessed with two children. She and her husband aim to improve their standard of living to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of their children. Due to financial difficulty, Vilma aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income.

Due to insufficient capital, Vilma is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that through patience and hard work, she will improve more of her business and hopes that she will improve her family's standard of living in the future to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo owns a hectare farm plot where he grows rice. He has cultivated this farm plot for almost 34 years and he is thankful that he is able to improve the growth of his rice crop and increase sales.

Rodolfo is now requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to ensure proper nutrition of his rice crop and the farm plot. He will use this loan to pay for land preparation and buy farm supplies to keep producing plentiful crops upon harvest time. In this way, he could earn enough profits to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and buy farm supplies to keep producing plentiful crops upon harvest time.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila is operating a sari-sari store in the village as a source of income. She is blessed with three children who are currently studying. With her business, she is able to provide their every day allowances but her income is insufficient for their tuition, so Sheila wants to improve her business more. Capital is a vital requirement in developing such a business. This causes Sheila to seek a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy rice, canned goods, noodles, and eggs. She hopes that through these added goods she will be able to earn more income in order to provide her children better schooling.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Due to a lack of job opportunities, Imelda buys and sells footwear in a market to generate additional income. She is now 40 years old and has three school-age children. She plans to continue sending her children to school so that they will gain degrees and become professionals someday. She also plans to acquire more footwear to sell but she does not have enough capital. Thus, she wants to ask for a loan of P15,000 to buy additional stock of slippers and shoes. She is hoping that she will improve her business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of slippers and shoes to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Buluk. She sells second-hand clothes, and has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Stella heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase second-hand clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Bendiya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques avec en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bougoufié de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente  des miches de pain, du riz, des mangues, d’échalotes et de bois de chauffe. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Salimata (1ère femme debout sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche) est une vendeuse de céréales au marché Château de Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de riz  avec les forains de Niono, au grand marché de Ségou; La revente se fait en détail au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché Château de Ségou, à une clientèle composée majoritairement d’hommes. 
Madame Salimata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments. Madame Salimata a pour objectif de pérenniser son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The members of the Bendiya group are married women, living mainly in polygamous families, on the average 45 years of age with four children. They all live in the Bougofié neighborhood of Sgou (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as relatives and neighbors. The group members buy and resell bread loaves, rice, mangoes, shallots and heating wood. 
With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their third solidarity loan.

Mrs. Salimata (the first one from right to left in the photo) sells cereals at the Château market of Segou. She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of rice from vendors at the big market of Segou. She sells retail, for cash and on credit, out of her home and at the Château market of Segou, to a customer base composed mainly of men. 

Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Salimata plans to achieve a monthly income of 50,000 West African Francs, which will be used to reinvested in the business and cover the costs of condiments for the household. Mrs. Salimata has a goal of stabilizing her business thanks to this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, aged 40, has been raising hogs for over 10 years. Her income from raising hogs supports her family. She is thankful for her business because it has been a great help in promoting her family's poor standard of living. 

She plans to increase the sales of her hogs, so to satisfy the buyers, she needs to provide good nourishment to her hogs. 

To provide it, she is requesting additional working capital of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, medicine, and vitamins. This loan will be a great help to make her hogs healthier and also to develop further her source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vitamins.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison, age 44, is married. His wife does household chores. They are blessed with four children between the ages of 7 months and twelve years. 

He works really hard to support his family by engaging himself in the motorcycle transportation business for customers within a busy urban market. His primary customers are businesspeople from the market. Harrison has been in this business for the last two years and previously was employed in a security firm. His business is faced with a challenge of frequent wear and tear expenses for the motorcycle. 

He is therefore planning to use the loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a new motorbike to aid in transportation to meet the customer demand. This is his second loan. Earlier on, he requested a loan of KES 20,000 from SMEP DTM and he managed to repay all of it well. 

His dream and hope is to own a motorcycle transportation firm in the next five years. Harrison is a focused and determined man who is a goal-oriented businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Hellen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 38 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has four children between 1 and 21 that live at home and three of them attend school. She has been involved in a beautician business since 2000. She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair, hair relaxer, and hair spray for her business. She has more customers and makes a lot of profit. Her plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair, hair relaxer, and hair spray for her business

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Djiguitougou sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 52 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bougoufié de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage; Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente  des miches de pain, du riz et des mangues. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.

Madame Aminata (femme debout au milieu sur la photo) est connue à Bougoufié et le marché Château Ségou pour la vente de riz. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 300 kilos de riz décortiqué auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes essentiellement en détail, au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché Château Ségou, à une clientèle mixte. Madame Aminata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of the six women in the Djiguitougou group are married and live in polygamous families. They have an average age of 52 and an average of five children each, all live in the Bougoufié neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth-largest administrative region in Mali) and are either neighbors or related to one another. The group members buy and sell bread rolls, rice and mangos, and to expand their business they have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third group loan.

Aminata (the woman standing in the middle) is well-known in Bougoufié and the Château Ségou market because of the rice she sells. She plans to use the loan to purchase 300 kg of husked rice from wholesalers. She makes retail cash and credit sales at home and at Château Ségou market to a mixed clientele. With her loan, Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which she plans to reinvest in her business and use to cover certain household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ozyuma

texts.en:
Ozyuma lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Ozyuma heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
La señora Santos de 42 años de edad, es soltera,  vive con sus cinco hijos tres de ellos ya trabajan y contribuyen a los gastos del hogar, radica en un barrio de Nacaome en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de abarrotería, en su pulpería ubicada en su casa. 
Doña Santos solicita el préstamo para la compra de Maíz, Frijoles, papas, condimentos, lácteos, embutidos y otros L.5,000.00 y para construir una cerca de la casa ahí también invertirá unos 6,000.00 lempiras, con este préstamo Doña Santos pretende aumentar su capital de su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de seguridad de su casa. 
Su sueño es construir un cuarto ha su casa  para que sus hijos puedan vivir más cómodamente.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012
texts.en:
Santos is 42 years old, single, and lives with her five children, three of whom work and help with the household expenses.  She lives in a neighborhood of Nacaome in the southern region of Honduras.  For the past 20 years, she has made a living selling groceries in the small store attached to her house.

Santos is asking for a loan of L.5,000.00 to purchase corn, beans, potatoes, seasonings, dairy products, sausages, and other goods, and she will also use 6,000.00 Lempiras to construct a fence around her house.  With this loan, Santos hopes to increase the capital of her business and improve the security of her house.  Her dream is to build a room onto her house so that her children can live more comfortably.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, potatoes, seasonings, dairy products, sausages, and other goods, and construction materials for a fence for her business.

loans.name: Patricia Delfina

texts.es:
La señorita Patricia Delfina esta casada, tiene 32 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación primaria, se dedica a la confección de pants, sudaderos y faldas, inicio este negocio como empleada y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos, para mejorar su producción de sudaderos, pants y faldas, y poder mejorar sus ingreso, en el futuro desea tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Patricia Delfina is 32 hers old and married. She completed her primary school education. She earns her living making pants, sweatshirts and skirts.
She started this business while working as a maid and now has 10 years experience. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics and thread to improve her production of sweatshirts, pants and skirts and to increase her income. In the future she hopes to have a large business.

loans.use: to buy thread for sewing.

loans.name: Gs Superacion De Linaca Group

texts.es:
La  Señora Felicita, tiene 35 años de edad tiene un hijo y es madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (pulpería) desde hace más de 6 meses, Doña Felicita, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico maíz frijoles y telas para la elaboración de faldas, camisas y pantalones para una buena atención a sus clientes, ya que al tener su negocio ubicado en su hogar, con el préstamo que reciba Doña Felicita, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y ayudarla a salir adelante.
Uno de los sus sueños de Doña Felicita es tener una de los mejores negocios de la zona.
La Señora Arminda, se dedica a la venta de abarrotería (pulpería).
El Señor Guillermo, se dedica a la venta de embutidos, carnes y lácteos, el tiene  (1) años de experiencia en el manejo del mismo.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Felicita is a 35 years old and is the single mother of one 2 child. She has worked selling groceries at a small store for over six months. She has requested this loan to buy products such as sugar, lard, soap, sodas, meat, toilet paper, corn, beans, and fabric to make skirts, shirts and pants, all to ensure good service for her customers. 

Felicita’s business is located in her home, and she plans to use the loan to improve her business and increase her income to meet her household expenses, give her family a better quality of life, and help them get ahead. One of Felicita’s dreams is to have one of the best businesses in the area.

Arminda sells groceries in a small store. Guillermo sells cold cuts, meat and dairy products, and has one year of experience in this area.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to purchase sugar, lard, soap, sodas, meat, toilet paper, corn, beans and fabric to make skirts, shirts and pants for her business.

loans.name: San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
La señora Edna Magali esta casada, tiene 40 años de edad, cursó su estudio como mae4stra de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a impartir curso en una escuela, como también a la siembra de remolachas pero actualmente quiere sembrar otro tipos de cultivos tiene 3 años de experiencia sembrando hortalizas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a atender la tienda que tienen.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran para la compra de semillas y tener mas cultivos, zanahorias, remolachas, rábanos, repollos, etc. Espera en el futuro tener mas produccion. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio, servicio de tienda y producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Edna Magali is married and is 40 years of age. She studied to be an elementary school teacher and has three children, all of whom are studying. She gives classes in a school and also works growing beets, but now wants to grow other kinds of crops. She has three years’ experience in growing vegetables, and is supported by her husband who runs the store that they have.

Edna Magali decided to create a group and request a loan, which she plans to use to buy seeds and grow more produce (carrots, beets, radishes, cabbages, etc.). In the future she hopes that her production will increase. The remaining members of the group sell goods, work in stores or are involved in agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres De Xecojom Group

texts.es:
La señora Melecia esta casada, tiene 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la fabricación de canastas, inicio este negocio juntamente con su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo de mujeres para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales, consistente en cintas de diferente diseños y colores, espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande y sobre todo rentable. Las demás integrantes de grupo se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales, y a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Melecia is 46 years old and she is married. She did not have the opportunity to study, but she has 4 children who are studying. She makes a living making baskets. She started this business together with her husband and she now has 8 years of experience. 

She organized a group of women in order to apply for a loan which will be used to buy materials consisting of ribbons of different colors and designs. She hopes to have a big, and most of all profitable, business in the future. The other group members make a living in retail, livestock breeding, and traditional craftwork.

loans.use: to buy plastic to make baskets

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda lives at San Roque with her spouse and one child. She has been selling grocery items to the people in her village for over three years now. From her business, she usually earns about PHP 4,000 each month and it is used as revolving capital and for her family's expenses. Now, she would like to increase the merchandise she sells so she is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, and school supplies to sell in her store. School supplies to sell will increase her income, especially in the coming school days. 

Melinda hopes to keep generating good profits from the business to achieve a prosperous life for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, and school supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
Bicycle repair is the business of William. He is from San Roque. He has been providing the services for over 10 years now and is very happy for the income of PHP 4,000 each month he generates from the business. He has six children to sustain. He wants to make improvements on the services he offers so he is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 from KIVA lenders. He will buy tools and machine oils used in his repair shop. He promises to pay back his loan in full. 

With good profits and determination to improve his small business, he hopes to achieve a prosperous life for his family.

loans.use: to buy tools and machine oils used in his repair shop.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is from San Roque. She operates a specialized store selling used clothes and bags. She purchases sacks of clothes from the public market and re-sells them for profits. She has been selling for three years now. Her customers are mostly her friends and neighbors. She aspires for an increase in income so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to invest in buying more used clothes, bags and caps to sell. This way she will offer more items which will lead to the increase of her income too. 

In the future, Marites would like to keep improving her business in order to pay her two children's school expenses. Someday, she will be very happy and proud to see them with good employment.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes, bags, and caps to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora’s main purpose in managing her business is to provide education to her three children. It helps her to save for their education. Her small eatery business is also a great help in providing their daily household needs.  She aims to increase her sales in order to increase the family's standard of living and develop her business. 

In connection to this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy raw ingredients to cook such as vegetables and meat.  She believes that with this loan amount, she can let her children finish their desired degree courses and sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to cook such as vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Pricila

texts.en:
Pricila, aged 54, is patiently managing a sari-sari business in the village.  Due to the hardship of life, she set up this kind of business. She aims to improve her small business to support her family, but she suffers with insufficient funds. To settle this situation, she is seeking additional working capital  of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, soaps, and soft drinks. She hopes to increase her sales through her product offerings.
She believes that the loan will help her to improve the business and hopes that she will become a successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soaps, and soft drinks.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 33 years old, married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. To make a living, George patiently provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. Income from his business was just enough for their daily consumption, especially for his children's school fees. 

He aspires for more profits so he can save funds to invest into a hog-raising business for additional income. He is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy crude oil and gasoline for the motorcycle. This way, he will continue to manage the smooth flow of his business. George is also praying for the safety of his traveling passengers.

loans.use: buy crude oil and gasoline for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani lives in Kator. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Amani heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is 49 years old, married and has four children. One is attending high school. To gain an income, Adelaida operates a business selling grocery items to the people in her village. She has been doing it for 10 years. She would like to increase the sales capacity of her business so she is taking out a loan of P5,000 to buy sardines, shampoo, breads and eggs to sell. Adelaida is also praying for good operation of her business that will someday lead her to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy sardines, shampoo, breads and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Levirato

texts.en: Levirato is 53 years old and married. He has four children. One is attending high school. The rest have settled into marriage now and live apart from him. He has been providing these services for over five years now. He is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy photo paper and film to use in his photography business. This will help improve his services and gain him more customers in his simple business. He usually earns about PHP 4,000 per month. Someday, he hopes to earn enough to invest in a hog-raising business for additional income.

loans.use: to buy photo paper and film to use in his photography business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Running a small store is the business of Imelda. She has been managing her store for more than two years now. She usually earns about P4,000 each month. She has four children and part of her profits goes towards school fees. She is now borrowing a loan of P5,000 to buy, and sell, more merchandise and increase her income too. 

Imelda would like to keep earning funds to pay for her children's education so that they will earn degrees and have better employment someday.

loans.use: to buy sardines, canned goods, noodles and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima is 53 years old, married, and has five children. Her spouse works as a laborer. Dulcisima's business is preparing and selling peanut butter. She has been in this kind of business for five years. She usually earns about PHP 3,000 each month. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy sugars and peanuts to use in the food-selling business. 

Dulcisima would like to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar and peanuts to use in the food selling business.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas and her family live in their small house at Balzain. She is now 53 years old and has three children. During weekends, her children sometimes help her in selling foods. Lagrimas has cooked and sold food for daily meals and snacks for over five years now.  

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to have additional capital for the business. She will buy pork and beef meat, vegetables, and onions to use in her food-selling business. From this, she will improve her sales. She is hoping to further develop her business and keep providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy pork and beef meat, vegetables, and onions to use in her food-selling business.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en: Joselito is a father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 38 years old and has two school-age children. He wants to upgrade the family's living condition to give them a better life. Joselito owns and manages their farm land by planting fruits and vegetables to later sell. This is the major source of their financial support. He had planned to plant more vegetables to sell, but he has inadequate funding to do so. Therefore Joselito is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. He believes that his loan will help him to improve his farming business, and hopes that he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for vegetable production

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BADEGNA sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à HEREMAKONO NORD, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce général, la fabrication et la vente d’encens  avec BINTOU, des condiments alimentaires et des produits de beauté .
BINTOU,  qui a le seau en plastique sur son pied, en boubou jaune, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 Kilos d’encens. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes en général, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Badegna group are all married, are on average 38 years old and have on average four children. They live in monogamous families in Heremakono Nord, one of the districts of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They are entering their third collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to satisfy the needs of their customers. This group of women is involved in general trade, the manufacturing and sale of incense (Ms. Bintou), food condiments and beauty products.

Ms. Bintou, who is dressed in a yellow bubu and is holding a plastic bucket, is planning to use her loan to buy five kilos of incense. She resupplies from wholesalers at the big market in Bougouni. She sells retail at the big market in Bougouni and at home to a clientele consisting of women for the most part, for cash or on credit.

She intends to realize an average monthly profit of 40.000 FCFA, part of which will be used to support her husband in dealing with daily expenditures, and the remainder invested in the business activity.

loans.use: Purchase incense

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BALIMAYA  est constitué de 3 femmes mariées et 1 célibataire. Elles  ont en moyenne 27 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des  familles monogames à HEREMAKONO NORD, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tasses avec ALIMATOU,  des tissus et des pommades.
ALIMATOU, tasses sur son pied, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 douzaines de tasses en aluminium et des tasses  thermos. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes  au  grand marché de Bougouni, en ambulant et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Balimaya group consists of three married women and one single woman. They are on average 27 years old with two children and all live in monogamous families in Beremakono Nord, one of the districts of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They are entering their first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, to satisfy the needs of their customers. This group of women retails cups (Ms. Alimatou), fabrics and beauty creams.

Ms. Alimatou, carrying basins, plans to use her loan to buy five dozen aluminum basins and thermos jugs. She resupplies from wholesalers at the big market of Bougouni and resells retail at the big market of Bougouni, as an itinerant vendor and at home to a clientele consisting of both men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to realize an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to support her husband in dealing with daily expenses, the remainder being reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: Buy basins

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les membres du groupe SABALI  sont des femmes  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à HEREMAKONO NORD, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pagnes, de tissus et de friperie avec ROKIA.
ROKIA,  qui a est en T-Shirt bleu, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 colis de friperie. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de BAMAKO auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabali group are all married women, averaging 39 years of age, with four children. They live in monogamous families in Herremakono Nord, a district in the town of Bougoni (the third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their second collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. This group of women sells traditional “pagnes” and other types of fabric as well as used clothing, which is what Rokia does, for example.

Rokia, the one wearing a blue T-shirt, plans to sue her loan to buy two bundles of used clothing. She buys from wholesalers at the big market of Bamako. She sells at the big market of Bougouni and out of her home, to a customer base composed of both men and women, retail, for cash and on credit. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 22,000 West African Francs, one part of which will be used to help her husband provide for everyday family needs, and the other invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 26 years old and single. He lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Khaled is looking to have a loan of 2,000 JOD to cover his wedding expenses and preparation costs. He will take another loan in the future to fix his home and improver its condition

Khaled is under 30 years old so his loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses

loans.name: Zubaidah

texts.en:
Zubaidah is 62 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of one child. She lives in Hai Nazal, Jordan.

Zubaidah is looking to have a loan of 1500 JOD so she can expand her work in fish sales; she will buy more quantites and cover a big area.

In the future Zubaidah looks to open a fish store and increase her income so she can build a new floor above her home to have more space.

loans.use: to buy fish for business purposes

loans.name: Hana'a

texts.en:
Hana'a is 35 years old and a married woman. She lives in Hay Nazal, Jordan. She is a mother of three children.

Hana'a is looking to have a loan of 450 JOD so she can buy more quantities of blankets for business purposes. She wishes to open her own store in the future which would increase her income and help her to buy a home.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for her business

loans.name: Muneera

texts.en:
Muneera is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Muneera is 45 years old and a married woman; she lives in Al Karak, Jordan.

Muneera is looking to have a loan of 800 JOD so she can buy more raw materials for milk and cheese sales. Her income will increase and she can buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy raw material for milk and cheese sales

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is 31 years old and a married woman; she is a mother of three children. She lives in Sahab, Jordan.

Noor is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD so she can improve her home living conditions and make her house more healthy for living.

loans.use: to improve her home living conditions

loans.name: Amena

texts.en: Amena lives in Kator. She sells food from a food stall, and has been in business for five years. Amena is 36 year old, married, and has five children; four of them are still in school. Amena heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Suzi

texts.en:
Suzi lives in Kator. She sells breads, and has been in business for two years. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children; both of them are still in school. 

Suzi heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Adilina

texts.en: Adilina lives in Kator. She operates food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 26 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. Adilina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and flour to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and flour to sell.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BADEGNA sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à  MASSABLACOURA, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce général, la vente de condiments avec  DJENEBA , du  bois de chauffe et du riz .
DJENEBA ,  en première de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50 Kilos de piments et et 1 carton de cube maggi . Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes en général, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the BADEGNA group are all married women who average 38 years of age and 4 children each.  They live in monogamous families in Massablaccoura, a neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).

It is the ninth time that these women are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet the needs of their customers.  DJENEBA sells condiments, while other women of the group are involved in general retail business, or sell firewood and rice.

Sitting first from the right in the photo, DJENEBA is planning to buy 50 kilos of pimento and one box of "Maggi" bouillon cubes. She buys her goods from wholesalers at the grand market in Bougouni.  She sells on that same market or from home to a customer base which mostly consists of women.  She sells retail, for cash and on credit.

DJENEBA is expecting average monthly profits to reach 90,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to help her husband cover the daily expenses, while the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKAN sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à  MASSABLACOURA, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires et du savons liquide  avec   DJELIKA , de pagnes, des friperies, du bois et des céréales.
DJELIKA  ,  en première position sur la photo en boubou noir, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 colis de condiments alimentaires, 4 cartons de savons liquide. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes en général, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKAN group are all married women who average 30 years of age and 4 children each.  They live in monogamous families in Massablacoura, a neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).

It is the second time that these women are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet the needs of their customers. While DJELIKA buys and sells condiments and liquid soap, other women of the group sell pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics), used clothing, wood and grains. 

Sitting in the front row and wearing a black boubou, DJELIKA is planning to use her loan to buy 2 packages of condiments for cooking and 4 boxes of liquid soap.  She buys her goods from wholesalers at the grand market in Bougouni. She sells on that same market and from home to a customer base which mostly consists of women. She sells retail, for cash and on credit.

DJELIKA is expecting average monthly profits to reach 60,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to help her husband cover the daily expenses, while the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods (condiments, liquid soap...)

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Desde Guayaquil José Luis de 37 años nos cuenta su historia, símbolo de superación y fuerza de voluntad. Su tienda la inicio hace varios años producto de un accidente que sufrió el cual lo dejo imposibilitado por un tiempo, debido a este suceso la empresa en la que trabajaba deicidio liquidarlo así que deicidio invertir el dinero. Su esposa Blanca quien a sido su apoyo incondicional es ama de casa y le ayuda en el negocio. El éxito de su tienda es que abre todos los días de lunes a domingo sin horario establecido. Tienen 2 hijos quienes estudian en una escuela fiscal cerca de su domicilio. El préstamo lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando una vitrina, víveres, confetis, arroz, azúcar. Le gustaría en próximos años ver su negocio ampliado.
texts.en:
From Guayaquil José Luis, 37, tells us his story, a symbol of triumph and willpower.  He opened his store several years ago as a result of an accident he had that left him disabled for a time.  Because of this event, the company he worked for decided to liquidate him so he decided to invest his money.  

His wife, Blanca, who has been his unconditional support is a housewife and helps him in his business.  His store’s success is because it’s open every day from Monday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  

They have two children attending a public school near their home.  He will use the loan to invest in his business buying a display case, foodstuffs, confetti, rice and sugar.  He’d like to see his business expand over the next years.

loans.use: to buy a display case, foodstuffs, confetti, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El joven Julio Cesar es soltero, tiene 24 años de edad, logro graduarse, como perito contador, pero actualmente trabaja como confesionista, inicio este negocio por necesidad y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.

Solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos y mejorar su produccion de camisas, espera en el futuro espera tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Young Julio Cesar is a single 24-year-old. He  graduated as an accountant but currently works as a clothing manufacturer. He started in the business out of necessity and he now has has 3 years experience. He has the full support of his parents.

He requests this loan to buy fabrics and threads and improve his shirt production. He hopes that in the future he will have an ample busines.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for clothes manufacturing

loans.name: Chocaman Group

texts.es:
La señora Santiaga es casada, tiene 53 años de edad, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y tamaño, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, el negocio que tiene inició siendo vendedor ambulante, lleva hasta el momentos 21 años de experiencia. 

Decide organizar un grupo para pedir y solicitar un préstamo, que lo utilizaran para la compra de mercadería para la venta, ya que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, van a comprar bufandas, medias, calcetines, chumpas, gorras, y entre otros tipos de ropa. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, y los demás a la crianza d animales domésticos. En el futuro desean tener su negocio con locales comerciales.
texts.en:
Santiaga is 53, married and makes a living selling clothes of all kinds and sizes. She didn't have the chance to get an education. She started her business as a street vendor and so far she has 21 years experience.

She decided to start a group to request a loan that they will use to buy merchandise to sell. Since she sells new clothes they are going to buy scarves, stockings, socks, jackets, and hats among other types of clothing.

The other members of the group make a living in commerce and the rearing of domestic farm animals. In the future they want to have their own business with business premises.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is a mother who is married to a farmer and they raise their family in a village. They are gifted with five children and they want them to each earn a degree so that they find good jobs someday. To generate income, they help each other in managing their farm lot by planting corn and vegetables to sell. They aim to increase their yields so they have the income to meet their daily needs and pay for their children's education. Leonor and her husband have plans to expand their planted corn to ensure high production, but they have not been able to do so because they cannot afford it. So, Leonor is requesting an additional P35,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in corn farming. This loan will enable she and her husband to expand their planting. They are hoping to have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn farming

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 30, married, and has three school-age children. They live happily in a village planting and harvesting corn and vegetables to sell. Due to financial difficulty, Joyce and her husband would like to improve their farming business to earn a higher income, which would allow them to meet the family's needs and pay for their children's education. The two help each other in cultivating their farm lots to ensure a high production. They have been farming for almost five years and usually earn a profit of P25,000 in every harvest season. Joyce and her husband use their income to pay for their daily needs and their children's school costs. To improve their farming business, Joyce is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay labor costs for planting the corn. She and her husband believe that they can improve their farming business as they continue to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay the labor costs for planting corn

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold believes that "Patience and hard work are the key to overcome poverty." He is 32 years old and still single. His ambition in life is to help his parents support his younger brothers and sisters, and to improve their status of living. He plans to educate his younger bothers and sisters so that they will earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Arnold needs to improve his hog-raising business to generate additional income. He is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising. The loan will help him to work toward his plan of growing his business to help his family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines

loans.name: Sabel

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Sabel supports her husband in managing their farm lot. She is 21 years old and has one infant child. They live in a rural community, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. They aim to earn and save more income to build their own house and satisfy their daily needs. They plan to expand their vegetable production to increase their production. 

Due to inadequate capital, Sabel is requesting for an additional of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production. She mentioned that her loan will help them to make an improvement in their farming business and hopes that they will have high yield this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is living in San Jose with her parents. She is single and did not finish a college degree so she decided to help her parents manage their small business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy pork meat, ingredients, and rice to cook and sell in her food stall. This will help meet her customers' demand for the delicious food she offers. She hopes to keep earning good profits from the business so she can save funds to use in times of emergency. Though she did not finish her education, she is very happy to manage a business now. She hopes that someday, she will achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy pork meat, ingredients, and rice to cook and sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 42 years old and now a widow. She lives in a rural community with her three children. Despite financial difficulty, she has the determination to raise their standard of living to give her children a better life. She cultivates their farm land by planting a variety of vegetables for sale. She plans to continue sending her children to school so that they will earn a degree and become professionals someday. 

Her children are now in secondary and tertiary education. Due to high cost of school fees, Carmelita aims to plant more vegetables so that she will increase her production and income to support her children's education. She is requesting additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production. She hopes that her patience and hard work will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is a hard-working father who raises his family in a village. He is 43 years old and has seven grown children. He aims to become successful in life to support his family and educate his children. He owns and manages his farm lots by planting rice and vegetable for sale. He planned to plant more vegetables to increase his production and income. 

Due to financial burden, Amor is asking for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production. He believes that this loan will help him to improve his farming business and hopes that he will have high yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 28 years old and has three school-age children. She lives with her children in a rural community because she is separated from her husband due to misunderstanding and unavoidable circumstances. Despite this, she has the strong determination to give her children a better life through the help of her beloved parents. Farming is the main source of their living. They plant fruits and vegetables and raise livestock for sale. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aimed to plant more vegetables to increase her production and income to satisfy her family's needs. She asks for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay the labors cost incurred in planting vegetables. She believes that she can increase her production and income through her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay the labor costs incurred in planting vegetables.

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.en:
Anacleto is a 39-year-old married man with one child. Anacleto involved himself in raising crops, particularly planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been in the business for 10 years and earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest season twice a year. He is now asking for additional capital of PHP 12,000. He will buy 9 bags of rice seeds and 10 bags of fertilizers to use in farming. He hopes this loan will be given to him as a way of improving his crop production and enabling him to pay his child's education. 
Anacleto hopes to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy 9 bags of rice seeds and 10 bags of fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George's primary source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. This way, he earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest season twice a year.

George is now 41 years old, married, and has four children attending to school. He would like to improve his farming output but he has inadequate funds to sustain his crops. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming. This will help improve good growth of his crops and will increase his income too. 

George would like to keep producing abundant harvests from the farming business in order to pay his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business of Bernardo. He lives in his small house at Roma Sur with his wife and four children. His wife helps him manage the farming business. They have been planting and harvesting rice for over 10 years and earn a minimum income of PHP 8,000 per harvest season. 

Now, Bernardo is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for crop maintenance. He hopes to keep growing rice to meet all his children's needs for school fees.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia raises crops in her village at Roma Sur. She is widowed, therefore she carries the burden alone of sending her three children to school. She pays for laborers who help her in sowing, tilling, planting, and harvesting rice. She has been in the farming business for 10 years and earns PHP 12,000 each harvest season twice a year. The money is used for meals, electric bills, and school fees. 

Leticia would like to make her crops produce more so she is now asking for a loan to maintain her farm. She is asking for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor costs of farming. She hopes to keep making the business profitable and gain enough funds for her family's progress.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor costs of farming

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
